issues.description: NoneType error in Scheduler.idle_seconds: If self.next_run is None (when no jobs are scheduled), calling (self.next_run - datetime.datetime.now()).total_seconds() will raise a TypeError
Type error in Job.at method: The hour variable might be a string when passed to datetime.time(), but it should be an integer
NoneType error in Job.__str__: Accessing self.job_func.__name__ without checking if self.job_func is None first
NoneType error in Job.__str__: Accessing self.job_func.args without checking if self.job_func is None first
NoneType error in Job.__str__: Accessing self.job_func.keywords without checking if self.job_func is None first
Missing error handling in Job.run: No try/except block around self.job_func() call, so any exception in the job function will propagate and potentially crash the scheduler
Logic error in Job.to method: The condition 'if not (self.latest >= self.interval)' is checking if latest is less than interval, but the error message says the opposite
